message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis uses both the World Development Indicators and UNDP Human Development Reports to examine the relationship between access to education and poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "UNDP Human Development Reports"], "topic": ["Education", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize a combination of satellite data from Landsat 7 and demographic data from the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs to study urbanization trends in Africa over time.", "dataset": ["Landsat 7", "United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs"], "topic": ["Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "In order to better understand the impact of extractive industries on local economies, we use data from the Resource-Fund National Accounts Database and the Center for International Earth Science Information Network.", "dataset": ["Resource-Fund National Accounts Database", "Center for International Earth Science Information Network"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Economy"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on primary survey data collected by the International Livestock Research Institute, as well as secondary data sources such as the FAOSTAT database, to investigate the links between pastoralist livelihoods and climate change adaptation strategies.", "dataset": ["International Livestock Research Institute", "FAOSTAT database"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Livelihoods"]}, {"sentence": "Using publicly available trade data and company financial statements, we analyze the effects of participation in global value chains on firm-level productivity in developing countries.", "dataset": ["publicly available trade data", "company financial statements"], "topic": ["Trade", "Productivity"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the effectiveness of social protection programs in reducing inequality in Latin America and the Caribbean, this paper uses household survey data from the Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean.", "dataset": ["Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Inequality"]}, {"sentence": "We use data on rural electrification rates from the Global Tracking Framework and household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys to study the effects of energy access on health outcomes in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Tracking Framework", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Energy", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a unique dataset on infrastructure projects financed by China in African countries to analyze the characteristics of Chinese infrastructure investments and their impact on economic development.", "dataset": ["unique dataset on infrastructure projects financed by China in African countries"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Economic Development"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the effect of migration on education outcomes in developing countries, we combine data from the World Bank's Migration and Remittances database with data from the Education Policy and Data Center.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Migration and Remittances database", "Education Policy and Data Center"], "topic": ["Migration", "Education"]}, {"sentence": "Using household consumption data from the World Bank's PovcalNet database and agricultural productivity data from the Food and Agriculture Organization, this analysis examines the relationship between agricultural productivity and poverty reduction in Asian economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank's PovcalNet database", "Food and Agriculture Organization"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This analysis uses both the World Development Indicators and UNDP Human Development Reports to examine the relationship between access to education and poverty reduction.",
